content.rendered:
United Help Ukraine, Inc. is a charitable non-profit 501(c)(3) organization which means that all of your donations are tax deductible to the full extent under section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code and within the guidelines of U.S. Law.

100% of all donations go to the cause (minus small transactions fees) and dedicated to help Ukraine.

100% volunteer based organization, operating at less than 1% admin costs, we help those at the front lines protecting Ukraine from the Russian invasion, also the families of wounded and fallen Heroes, as well as people who had to leave their homes and are in need of temporary aid.

Our activities focus on fundraising events and raising awareness about the war in Ukraine by engaging individuals, organizations, private and government institutions, and media in the United States of America.

We are receiving and distributing donations, food and medical supplies to the Ukrainian refugees, people of Ukraine affected by the ongoing war in Ukraine, families of wounded or killed for freedom and independence of Ukraine.

We have held multiple rallies in Washington, DC in support of Ukraine’s freedom and independence. We have also organized multiple protests in response to the annexation of Crimea by the Russian Federation, as well as the Russia-sponsored armed conflict on the eastern territories of Ukraine, and the fatal crash of the Malaysia Airlines plane MH-17 shot down by the Russia-sponsored terrorist group on these territories.

We regularly organize fundraisers which benefit people in Ukraine affected by the war conditions, such as providing medical supplies to hospitals and various volunteer groups in Ukraine, performing clothing drives for orphan refugee children, as well as families of the wounded or killed soldiers, and providing aid to the families who lost their loved ones in this Russia-sponsored conflict.

United Help Ukraine participates in local cultural events to help build the image of Ukraine.

United Help Ukraine (UHU) is pleased to announce that it has been approved to participate in the Federal Government’s employee charitable giving campaign for 2019, the Combined Federal Campaign. Federal Government employees who participate, or would like to participate, in the CFC, and would like to designate UHU as recipient of all or a portion of their charitable giving, UHU’s listing is #71359 as an independent organization.
